required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Extubation Criteria in Patients Greater Than 59 Years of Age
clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective Evaluation of Extubation Criteria in Patients Greater Than 59 Years of Age Following Anesthesia and Non-cardiac Surgery

brief_summary.textblock: Prospectively evaluate the predictive value of individual pre-specified clinical extubation criteria for extubation success

detailed_description.textblock: Perform a prospective observational study to evaluate routine criteria commonly used to extubate elderly patients in the operating room after non-cardiac and non-thoracic surgery to ultimately reduce the incidence of near-term reintubation and by extension other respiratory complications

primary_outcome.measure: Extubation Success or Extubation requiring Intervention
primary_outcome.description: Quality of extubation will be assessed using a standard rubric for all extubation.

primary_outcome.measure: Presence or Absence of specific extubation criteria.
primary_outcome.description: Assess the presence of specific extubation criteria met during extubation from the following list: Following Commands, Tidal volume>4 cc/kg, Conjugate gaze, End-tidal CO2 (ETCO2) <55 mmHg, ET agent concentration < (Des 1%, Iso <=0.2%, Sevo <0.3%, oxygen saturation (SpO2) > 94%,Qualitative or quantitative Tetralogy of Fallot (TOF), Purposeful Movement, 5 second head lift, Spontaneous Respiratory Rate >=8 bpm at extubation, eye opening

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants with Preoperative Exposures (ASA) American Society of Anesthesiologists Emergency Status
secondary_outcome.description: The classification system alone does not predict the perioperative risks, but used with other factors (eg, type of surgery, frailty, level of deconditioning), it can be helpful in predicting perioperative risks

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants with Preoperative Exposures (COPD) Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease
Number of Participants with Preoperative Exposures (Dementia)

Number of Participants with Preoperative Exposures (obstructive sleep apnea by history or STOP BANG) (snoring, tiredness, observed apnea, blood pressure, body mass index, age, neck circumference and gender)

Number of Participants with Preoperative Exposures (Sleep Disordered breathing by history or STOP BANG) (snoring, tiredness, observed apnea, blood pressure, body mass index, age, neck circumference and gender)
Number of Participants with Preoperative Exposures (Neuro-degenerative disorders)
secondary_outcome.description: Neuro-degenerative disorders such as: amyotrophic lateral sclerosis, Parkinson's, multiple sclerosis, Alzheimer's, Huntington's

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants with Preoperative Exposures (Heart failure)
Number of Participants with Preoperative Exposures (Opioid na√Øve)
secondary_outcome.description: by history or from electronic health record

Number of Participants with Preoperative Exposures (ESRD) End-Stage Renal Disease
Number of Participants with Preoperative Exposures (CVA) cerebrovascular accident - medical term for a stroke
Number of Participants with Preoperative Exposures (Chronic Restrictive Lung disease)
Number of Participants with Preoperative Exposures (Current Smoker)
secondary_outcome.description: current smoker or >=20 year pack history

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants with Preoperative Exposures (Inhalational agent used for maintenance)
secondary_outcome.description: Anesthetic maintenance agent used at time of extubation

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants with Preoperative Exposures (Use of (NMB) Neuromuscular Blocker
Number of Participants with Preoperative Exposures (Use of Midazolam)
Number of Participants with Preoperative Exposures (Use of opioid agonist during preoperative or intraoperative phase)
Number of Participants with Preoperative Exposures (Use of blood or other blood products such as platelets, FFP(Fresh frozen plasma), or Cryo)
Number of Participants with Preoperative Exposures (Regional Anesthesia other than local infiltration)
Number of Participants with Preoperative Exposures (Type of inhalational agent used for maintenance)
secondary_outcome.description: Qualitative measures will be used to analyze this Outcome Measure

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants with Preoperative Exposures (Use of train of 4 monitoring)
secondary_outcome.description: A peripheral nerve stimulator, also known as a train-of-four monitor, is used to assess neuromuscular transmission when neuromuscular blocking agents (NMBAs) are given to block musculoskeletal activity

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants with Preoperative Exposures (Use of Sugammadex for reversal)
Number of Participants with Preoperative Exposures (Use of Neostigmine for reversal)
Anesthesia Time during procedure
Number of Participants with Preoperative Exposures (Difficult Airway)
secondary_outcome.description: Difficult Airway or use of alternative airway technique other than DL because of suspected difficulty with the airway

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants with Preoperative Exposures (Intracranial Procedure)
Number of Participants with Preoperative Exposures (positive end-expiratory pressure (PEEP)
secondary_outcome.description: (PEEP) positive end-expiratory pressure >7 cmH2O for >10 minutes

other_outcome.description: 30 Day mortality obtained from the chart in order to determine association with intervention required at extubation

arm_group.arm_group_label: Patients undergoing general endotracheal anesthesia that will be extubated following the procedure
arm_group.description: Patients 60 years of age and older undergoing general anesthesia and non-cardiac surgery will be observed by a member of the research team independent from the team caring for the patient at the time of emergence and extubation

study_pop.textblock: Patients 60 years of age and older undergoing general anesthesia and non-cardiac surgery will be observed by a member of the research team independent from the team caring for the patient at the time of emergence and extubation

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- >= 60 years of age
- Patients undergoing general endotracheal anesthesia for surgery or invasive diagnostic procedures that are anticipated to be extubated immediately following the procedure
Exclusion Criteria:
- Age<60 years of age
- Patients with a tracheostomy in - situ (pre-existing or placed as part of the index procedure)
- Patients undergoing cardiac surgical procedures
- Patients undergoing general endotracheal anesthesia who are not anticipated to be extubated immediately following the surgical procedure
- Patients with delayed extubations in the post anesthesia care unit or intensive care unit)
- Patients undergoing TIVA (Total Intravenous Anaesthesia)
- Patient with an initial room air SpO2<93%
- Patients with VADS (ventricular assist device) undergoing non-cardiac surgery
- Thoracic surgical procedures
- Patients on home oxygen
- Patients getting general anesthesia with supraglottic airway

reference.citation: Behrendt CE. Acute respiratory failure in the United States: incidence and 31-day survival. Chest. 2000 Oct;118(4):1100-5.
Alvarez MP, Samayoa-Mendez AX, Naglak MC, Yuschak JV, Murayama KM. Risk Factors for Postoperative Unplanned Intubation: Analysis of a National Database. Am Surg. 2015 Aug;81(8):820-5.

Tillquist MN, Gabriel RA, Dutton RP, Urman RD. Incidence and risk factors for early postoperative reintubations. J Clin Anesth. 2016 Jun;31:80-9. doi: 10.1016/j.jclinane.2015.12.038. Epub 2016 Apr 12.
